text:
(This bug occures within Tomcat 4.0 beta2, beta3 and beta4 versions, wheras 
beta1 works correctly.)

From within a filter I create a session and store an object as a session 
attribute. Then I use a jsp page to access this object. Therefore I have to 
cast the object to its type when using session.getAttribute().
This works fine, as long as the application is not reloaded.
After a reload (which I initiated using the manager application) a 
ClassCastExceptio occurs. For reproducing this bug, it seems to be crucial that 
the session is created within a filter and that the object stored as a session 
attribute is also created there. The object should be a self-written test-
object that belongs to the web-application's code.
I have registered the web-app within the server.xml file. It is no war file.
I have written a small demonstration web-app which can be downloaded from 
HTTPS://spares.airbus.com/demo1.zip

This application has an index.jsp file that also contains a short description 
of what has to be done exactly to reproduce this bug.
creator: scoenen@gmx.de

text:
Meanwhile I have downloaded and tested Tomcat 4.0 beta 5 
and the bug exists in this version as well.
creator: scoenen@gmx.de
remm@apache.org
text:
It was a classloading problem, very similar to the one reported by Jon Stevens 
when trying to run Scarab.
The test case does not fail after reloading with the current (fixed) code from 
CVS.
